comment.comment: I'm a little confused on the "also for example in a VR cinema, where all the players are controlled from a PC." From my understanding, with an interactive VR piece, the desktop mimics what's played in the HMD. If you are looking for a 'desktop seek feature' from what's already in the final mix, that remote control would not be available anytime soon. If you are trying to mix from desktop while wearing HMD, that might be something we'd consider supporting.
comment.author: Dodge McIntosh

data.post:
Hi everyone, I just wanted to share some recent news regarding G'Player, our local playback app that has the G'Audio Sol SDK integrated into it. We have removed the Cardboard version of G'Player from the G'Audio website and from the Google Play Store. 

We will be focusing on supporting the Gear VR version of G'Player moving forward. To install and activate that version of GâPlayer from the Oculus store, you need to get a redemption code from our website. Simply sign in to your G'Audio account (or sign up if you haven't already) and click on the "Gear VR G'Player Download" button that can be found at the bottom of the page at https://www.gaudiolab.com/gaudiosol. 

There you can find all the instructions you need to get started along with your redemption code. Of course, don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions!

Basically all the songs on here were / are big from 85, Polar Palooza, Teen/Grizz, Adult Dance, Roadtrips, Opening and Closing Shows, MDR, mornings in Cedar, SNP's, Dance Marathon?, and Boner Jams of the 80's, 90's, and today.

If you're thinking, "But DÃ¶dge, I don't recognize this song from any of those things..." It's because I thought it would be fun to dance and/or sing to when I'm wasted. Deal with it. And boner jam.

data.post:
On the topic of @[100000249009730:2048:Sam]'s question, start thinking of MDR routines now!  What better way to procrastinate for finals than thinking about Bruin Woods?! (And doing something productive at the same time...)

For those of you who don't know, MDR is our Music and Dance Revue (essentially an amazing staff talent show) that we put on every Monday night at the amphitheater.  Performances cover all kinds of talent including playing musical instruments, comedic routines, dancing, musical theater, and everything in between!

Clee posted a great one by Klau down below in the other post, but if you want to get more ideas, it's really easy to Youtube "Bruin Woods MDR" and stuff will come up!  If you have any other questions or want help developing your performance, please feel free to message myself or @[503422899:2048:Vergel] or really anybody who has done it in the past.  

Happy procrastinating!
-DÃ¶dge 

P.S. Just another one to get ya started: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2TCJ_u8j_zE

data.post:
At the beginning of each 3-hour morale shift, the room deÌcor, music, and costumes will change and a fresh group of enthusiastic moralers will flood the dance floor. During each shift, there will be costume contests. Each Dancer Captainâs Color Team will be competing for the BEST and MOST costumes. Below are all the shift subthemes to plan your costumes accordingly!

12pm-3pm Bright Lights, Big City
Start off the theme shifts with an illuminating trip around the world. From Sin City to the Holy City, weâre going to spread our fight for the cause to every corner of the globe, so grab your most badass beret, or your classiest kimono, and letâs come out in style for this celebration of cultures. Whether you want to be bold and British, risqueÌ and Russian, or sexy and Spanish, letâs represent every city and country with our commitment to the fight against Pediatric AIDS. Itâs a worldwide problem, but together, as one people, we can eradicate it.

3pm-6pm Spotlight
This is your chance to ignite your alter ego and become the star you truly are. Whether you rep the âSingle Ladiesâ like BeyonceÌ or you can bend it like Beckham, stardom is calling your name. For these 3 hours revel in the glory of fame and release your Sasha Fierce (swagger) because itâs your one chance to be a celebrity. What better time is there to take center stage than in the fight against AIDS and become the face of this great cause?! Prepare your accep- tance speeches ladies and gentlemen because you may be in the running for the award of Best Featured Dancer. Under the spotlight there can only be one, will it be you?

6 pm-9pm Friday Night Lights
Clear eyes, full hearts, CANâT LOSE! Great moments are born out of great opportunity and thatâs what we have here right now ladies and gentleman. Time to bring out everything youâve got; everything athletic that is. The crowd is pumped, the lights are bright, and the moment is ready for the taking! Sport (get it!?) the most athletic attire that you have whether that means bringing out the pom-poms, unveiling that jersey youâve hidden for so long, dressing up as your favorite athlete, or even rocking John Woodenâs glasses. Just remember one thing: this is Dance Marathon and NO ONE BEATS US ON OUR HOME TURF!

9pm-12am The Twilight Zone
Youâre moving into a land of both shadow and substance, of ghostly things and ghoulish ideasâ youâve just crossed over into...the Twilight Zone. As we dance through our night shift, two-step into another dimension of boogie man boogiers and skeleton shufflers. Throw on those Hal- loween costumes that usually only resurrect once a year (NOT mouse ears and lingerie!) and dance to the most twisted âTwist and Shoutâ of your afterlife. Dress as a devilish demon, vi- cious vampire (...not Edward), or zany zombie, and be ready to groove in a graveyard and scare away stigma.

12am-3am Let There Be Bright
Imagine getting tased and hit by lightning at the same time. Now think of going skydiving and realizing your parachute is broken and you are all scared and stuff but then you fix it and youâre like âwoah! Close call!â and then as you float safely to the ground you find a hundred dollars in your pocket. If the mental and physical aspects of those two experiences could somehow mesh into one three-hour chunk of time, it would be this shift. There is little you can do to prepare yourself for the sheer carnage and energy of this shift. Let there be Bright, people. Let there be Bright. Bring forth your brightest and your tightest. Pierce the dim light of AGB with your neon, your spandex, and maybe even those Velcro shoes from the nineties that light up every time you take a step. Let the hazy collective glow of our clothing seep from the doors and windows of the ballroom and let those outside know that for those three shining hours, we brought light to a place where there once hadnât been, and with it hope to those who once had none.

3am-6am Night Light
SHIFT THEMES
Lullaby...and goodnight....go to sleep...WHOA, WHOA, WHOA, wait a sec. You canât go to sleep when thereâs plenty of dance moves to show off. Hop into your finest pair of jammies and say goodnight to Pediatric AIDS. Better turn that night light on because Ackerman is about to turn into a full-fledged slumber party! Ever wished that it was still socially acceptable to rock out in those onsie pajamas in the back of your closet that your Great Aunt Marjorie got for you for your 18th birthday? Yup, thought so! Now it is. This is your chance to relive those cherished childhood memories. Except, thereâs no crying to your mama. Just dancing...only dancing.

6am-9am Red, Light & Blue
Ohhhhh say can you see, by the dawnâs early light!! As we open the curtains of the ballroom and let the sun shine in, itâs time to show that country pride and bring out all that Red, Light, and BLUE! We are the home of the brave, and itâs time to prove it! Get ready for a guest ap- pearance from Mr. President himself! Just kidding, heâs not coming, but that doesnât mean you still canât dress to impress! Pull out all the stops with the most creative costumes; sparkly fireworks, a big American flag, Stagecoach regulars, Abraham Lincoln Vampire Hunter, you name it. Show your loyalty to the land of the free and home of the Dance Marathon. âMERICA!

9am-10:30 am Lumos
Blast through platform 9 3â4 and into the land all things magical. Mount your dragons and jump aboard the Hogwarts Express because were gearing up for the duel of the century. Hobbits, mermaids, witches, centaurs, and mythical creatures galore are apparating from around the mythical world to stand up to pediatric AIDS. Can you say Avada Kedavra? No sense in packing light for this adventure because weâll be voyaging from the siren infested waters of the Atlantic to the land of the wildlings and beyond the wall. Your remembrall is sure to not let you forget this battle, itâs going to be preciousssss (Gollum voice).

10:30 am- 1pm Bruin Pride
Think back to the campus tour you took as a senior in high school, when your tour guide non- chalantly mentioned something called Dance Marathon somewhere between how cool it was that Old School was filmed in Kerckhoff and how they love to hang out by Jans Steps and go slacklining. Back then Dance Marathon was just a passing thought, just another of the million things to do at this crazy, gigantic school. Fast forward to today: It seems pretty much agreed that it is a good time to be a Bruin. With new Pauley killing it and varsity athletics that are actually competitive, our beautiful campus is feeling more alive than ever before. The squir- rels are less aggressive, the Peace Sign guy is gone, and there have never been so many ins- tagrams of Royce quad. Put simply, this campus is something to be proud of. Fast Forward to Dance Marathon: After 25 hours of non stop Pediatric AIDS killing dance floor action it may be safe to assume that youâll need something special to put that extra pep in your step, and for that we are going to call upon everything we love about this campus and this school. Ev- erything that makes this place the best school on earth. For this final shift join your fellow Bruins in wearing your bluest and goldest threads and let the collective Bruin Spirit help you complete the most rewarding 26 hours youâll ever have.

12PM â 1PM: POWER HOUR
Power Hour! Pump it up Bruins as we power through the last hour! Sport that Blue and Gold while you shake it like Joe Bruin as we show this global pandemic what an 8-clap is really all about. UCLA Fight! Fight! Fight!

data.post:
Â¡Hola Amigos!  Happy 4th of January to everyone! (It's Ramona's Independence Day)

Just got back from BW New Year's and wished you all could have been there!  Except a few of you, you know who you are...@[533555631:2048:Moffa].  But I did come back with a big box of goodies for all of you --- RECRUITING SHIRTS!!!

As y'all know, Winter Quarter is our big recruiting quarter, and while the recruitment team will be doing some specific things this quarter, we need the help of EVERBODY [insert "you, you, and you"] to make BW Staff 2013 the BEST EVER.

So, the deets:
- Come to my apartment 437 Gayley, Apt. 104 to pick up your shirt!
- When wearing your shirt, remember, we are representing Bruin Woods, so always be on your best (and most upbeat/hype) behavior!

People will also be coming to you asking you all kinds of questions so now for the dates:
+ Flyering all quarter on Bruin Walk
+ Jan. 16 Flyering Power Hour in Bruin Plaza
+ Jan. 31 Bruin Woods Information Session in JWAC from 5-6pm
+ Feb. 1 Returning Applications Due (just for you guys)
+ Feb. 12 APPLICATION DEADLINE (and Lincoln, Darwin, and my birthday nbd)

data.post:
IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM CHANCELLOR GENE D. BLOCK:

So apparently some of you were A LITTLE confused about my last message (have no idea why), so hopefully this one will help clarify.  I'll try to keep it short and sweet:

This Friday is UCLA's Homecoming Rally.  Dylan wants all of us to go in order to get people excited about recruitment and BW even this early in the school year.

Ssooooo... I have 40 tickets for the Rally and Pauley events.  We will be assembling at Red Roebling at around 5:30 for some pre-kooking activities, then getting to the event at 5:30 for lots of fun times (at which we will be MAD HYPE and wreck everyone).

After thatttttt... We will be going back to Red Roebs to celebrate the birthday of one beautiful @[515660409:2048:Ben Babies Davies] in proper BDubz form. (<3 U 69 Roommie)

Attire:  We should all be matching, and as of now I think the only way for that to work is for us to wear our staff shirts (I know it's kinda weird but Dyl wants us all matching and I don't think we have enough recruiting shirts left over from last year?)

Please like this if you can go so I know to get more tickets if need be, and hit me up if you have any questions...

Cannot wait to see you all together again (fuck you @[1043010649:2048:Rob], but not the other abroad people) and LET"S DO IT BIG!!!

From the office of the chancellor,
#partyblock

OH WASAAA PARTY PEOPLE!
I know most of you have been asking, "When is The Candyman coming back into my life??"

Well here he is bitches, and he hopes all of you will be coming back into his life soon! UCLA's Homecoming Rally is right around the corner (Nov. 2nd) and as part of hyping up YEAR ROUND recruiting efforts, we want to have a big, united BDubz contingent there!

I know a few of you aren't around Westwood anymore, but for those of you who are, we are going to pre-kook (but not "too hard" per Dylan's request) the rally and Pauley event, and then post-kook (much harder per my request) after at someone's apartment! (Maybe mine, maybe Red Roebs, we'll see....)

So get those staff shirts out and, I'll be sending out final details soon, but in the words of Kyre Rau...
#partyrock

group_posts.title: Dodge McIntosh posted in Urgent! DM Needs $ For DM!

data.post:
Just wanted to take a second to thank everyone who has joined the group, I really appreciate it. I'd also like to thank everyone who's donated, I'm almost there thanks to you! For those of you who haven't donated yet, I understand that this may not be the best time for giving money but...

1350 children die everyday from an AIDS-related illness and an additional 1000 are newly infected every day. The AIDS pandemic is the issue of our generation, and it is up to us to take a stand.  With a donation of just $8 you can provide a life-saving vaccine to infants at risk of acquiring the disease from their mothers. So please, the event is Saturday, please take a moment to make a donation, no matter how small, every bit helps save lives!
